instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hdmi and thunderbolt external monitor not working
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got this machine water damaged. Had been repaired and seems all working ok except of external monitor. When i conect HDMI or Thunderbolt the macbook display start blinking constantly and external monitor says "no signal"

Is that logic board or sofware issue?

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hdmi and thunderbolt external monitor not working
threads.message: The HDMI port is on the I/O Board, so my guess is bad I/O board/I/O Cable on that one. Thunderbolt is a total waste of time, and I would completely forget about it.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hdmi and thunderbolt external monitor not working
threads.message: Already tried to change board. My guess is <CHIP>U9750</CHIP> fucked.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hdmi and thunderbolt external monitor not working
threads.message: I was wright. Reballed <CHIP>U9750</CHIP> and hdmi and thunderbolts now working.
